structures

Class StatList

  • java.lang.Object
    • structures.StatList

  • public class StatList
extends java.lang.Object
    A list of all Stat sets based on a number of stats, a point cost chart and a maximum point value.

    Example stats are in the Dungeons and Dragons tabletop game. In this game, player characters have the following stats: Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma. Players are given the option to spend up to 27 points to increase these stats from the score 8 to a higher score up to 15. The scores 8 through 13 have costs of 0 through 5 respectively. The score 14 has a cost of 7, and the score 15 has a cost of 9. Thus, a player could have scores as extreme as [15,15,15,0,0,0] to as flat as [13,13,13,12,12,12].

    Stat sets listed in this class are ordered from the largest cost to the smallest cost. Thus, the first value in the stats array will be the best value of the array.

    This class is assuming it is implementing point-buy systems that humans would do manually. It is not intended for large scale packing problems.

    Version:
    1.1, 09/10/18
    Author:
    UnfortunatelyEvil

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static StatList getInstance(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> pointCosts,
                                   int numStats,
                                   int pointTotal)
        Returns a StatList built on the cost/score map, number of stats, and total available points.
        Parameters:
        pointCosts - mapping of the cost (key) and best score obtained from it (value). Do not include overflow costs ([2,13], [3,13], [4,14] : [3,13] wastes a point). Do include a default value if it exists: [0,8].
        numStats - number of stats to spread points across
        pointTotal - total number of points to spread across numStats stats
        Returns:
        a series of numStats possible stats that have a combined cost equal to the pointTotal

      • getInstance

        public static StatList getInstance(int[] costs,
                                   int[] scores,
                                   int numStats,
                                   int pointTotal)
                            throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns a StatList built on the cost and score arrays, number of stats, and total available points.
        Parameters:
        costs - array of specified costs for scores. These should only include the lowest cost for any given score.
        scores - array of the scores obtained from the costs. Scores should be in the same index as the corresponding cost.
        numStats - number of stats to spread points across
        pointTotal - total number of points to spread across numStats stats
        Returns:
        a series of numStats possible stats that have a combined cost equal to the pointTotal
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the costs and scores arrays have different lengths
